featured.text: Without the oxygen that plants give out, and without the food that they supply, life would grind to a halt and all animals would starve.
Moisture and oxygen promote oxidation and therefore limit its shelf life.
Because of the tremendous amount of oxygen produced in this area, it has been called the “lungs of the earth.”

definition.zh_def: 氧氣，一種無色無味的氣體，是生命所需的基本元素之一。
definition.en_def: Oxygen, a colorless and odorless gas, is one of the essential elements for life.
definition.example: Plants produce oxygen through the process of photosynthesis.
